result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Toni M Trotta

records.addlTxt: Atty Frank acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties and enters NG pleas.  All matters set for RD which may also be a plea/sent.  Bonds continued.

11:22 AM Defendant Toni M Trotta appeared by video.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Toni M Trotta.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Court notes 22CF400 is set for prelim today and 22CF189 and 22CF231 are set to track today.  Court is satisfied that the zoom system is working.  Counsel agrees.  Atty Frank notes the DE will waive her right to prelim today in 22CF400.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.
Return date scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on January 5, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
from Br. 1 granting request to appear by Zoom
DE's request to appear by zoom or telephone for waiver of prelim
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:38 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Toni M Trotta appeared by video, in custody.  Atty Dolch also appears by video from LEC.  Atty Mark Frank will likely be appointed.  DE does qualify for PD appt and address is correct.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  State makes bail argument - requests cash w/conditions.  Atty Dolch responds - requests signature bond or lesser cash bond.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $500.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  none.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
